answers.answer: Try reflexology candle lit baths with lots of bubbles get your husband to massage your back to not to much pressure though good luck

I know its easier said than done, but if you want to avoid complications you need to keep your stress level and blood pressure under control. It could lead to  preeclampsia and that is not good for you or baby (I had it with my first and had to be induced). Have your hubby join you to your dr's appt and ask him to be as helpful as he can with your other child. Again I know thats hard, I'm a mother of 6 and am due here shortly but I'm trying to take it easy. Remember to ask for help whether it be to friends or family members. Good luck!! :)
Increase your B vitamins and magnesium.  It's for the migraines but also helps the whole body.

question: Spent a little over 2.5 hours in labor and delivery yesterday having my blood pressure monitored. Thankfully got it back to normal for the last hour and sent home. Was told to rest more and avoid stress, haha, avoid stress?! Can someone fill me in on how to do that? Or fill my husband and child in on how to do it? Still have a headache but not my horrible migraine, but I can't sleep.On the positive the nurse said my little guy is amazing, awesome heart beat and able to keep it steady, plus one active strong guy for 27 weeks
title: blood pressure, causing a migraine, agg
